page.title: 05THE PARKYNS ALMSHOUSES BUNNY
page.content: Miss Honor Duncton who was once our school caretaker lives in one of the flats in the Armshouses. The outside door is very low and the walls are thick. There are three unusual oval windows. At the far end is the old Parkyns school which is now the Men's Institute snooker room and upstairs is another flat. There are old beams in the attic and the slate roof has been recently restored. {THE RANCLIFFE ARMS Mr. Alan Hill, an ex-Forest goalkeeper has owned the Rancliffe Arms for seven years. Sir Thomas Parkyns rebuilt the inn and held wrestling matches in the grounds, now the car park. It is said that Dick Turpin stopped there, but most of the activities today are organised by the Sports and Social Committee. There are darts teams and each year a village quiz is held.
